task_description: Facing the building to your North (approx. 341°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

action.raw_response: {"THOUGHT":"I need to see the full facade and roofline of the building ahead to estimate its height, so I should tilt the view upward while staying oriented north.","ACTION":"ROTATION(0,30)"}

reason: I need to see the full facade and roofline of the building ahead to estimate its height, so I should tilt the view upward while staying oriented north.
raw_response: {"THOUGHT":"I need to see the full facade and roofline of the building ahead to estimate its height, so I should tilt the view upward while staying oriented north.","ACTION":"ROTATION(0,30)"}

reason: I likely still can’t see the building’s base-to-roof extent at this upward pitch, so I should tilt back down to include the ground and estimate floors.
With the view angled down, I should now estimate the building height by counting visible stories and using a typical ~3.3 m per story scale.
